verses.roman:
eta cinti' gelā gaṅgāya madhyāhna karite
eka gauḍiyā kānthā dhuñā diyāche śukāite

synonyms: eta cinti'—thinking this; gelā—went; gaṅgāya—to the bank of the Ganges; madhyāhna—bathing at noon; karite—to do; eka—one; gauḍiyā—Bengali Vaiṣṇava; kānthā—quilt; dhuñā—washing; diyāche—spread out; śukāite—to dry.
translation: Thinking in this way, Sanātana went to the bank of the Ganges to bathe. While there, he saw that a mendicant from Bengal had washed his quilt and had spread it out to dry.
